feature: Word Library — Built-in curated word database

simulations.persona: Sofia, 19, university student, iPhone, low patience
simulations.scenario: Opens Word Library from footer, browses Daily Vocabulary, selects 'appreciate'
steps: Sees Library icon in bottom footer bar
Taps Library — navigates to /cards/library
Sees hero banner 'Discover New Words'
Scrolls through 6 category cards
Taps 'Daily Vocabulary' category
Sees 30 words listed with definitions
Taps 'appreciate' — word with 'Use →' button
Redirected to /cards/new?word=appreciate
Word input auto-populated with 'appreciate'
AI auto-generates 3 sentences and searches images
Selects image, taps Create — card created successfully
simulations.feedback: This is exactly what I needed! I don't have to think about which words to learn.

simulations.persona: Ahmed, 27, Arabic speaker, slow internet, medium patience
simulations.scenario: Switches to Arabic, then tries to use the Word Library
steps: Logs in, goes to settings, switches to Arabic
Returns to dashboard
Taps المكتبة (Library) in footer
Sees 'اكتشف كلمات جديدة' (Discover New Words) hero
Notices categories display Arabic names: 'مفردات يومية', 'إنجليزية الأعمال'
Taps 'كلمات السفر' (Travel Words)
Sees words listed with Arabic difficulty labels: مبتدئ, متوسط, متقدم
Taps 'accommodation'
Navigated to /cards/new — word pre-populated
AI generation takes 15+ seconds on slow connection
No timeout indicator — just a spinner
Eventually loads — creates card

issues_found.description: Category descriptions in Arabic are hardcoded in the data file, not pulled from translations — means they can't be updated via translation system alone

simulations.feedback: Arabic support is good but the loading time is painful.

simulations.persona: Emma, 37, non-technical, looking for French words
simulations.scenario: Searches Word Library for French vocabulary
steps: Opens Word Library from header icon
Sees search bar — types 'bonjour'
No results found

Types 'travel' — finds many travel-related words
Realizes library is English-only vocabulary
Still decides this is useful — selects 'cuisine'
Card creation works — AI generates English sentences about 'cuisine'

issues_found.description: No indication in the library that words are specifically for English vocabulary learning — could confuse users expecting multi-language support

simulations.feedback: The library is helpful but it should say 'English Vocabulary Library' not just 'Word Library'.

simulations.persona: James, 50, nurse, wants medical terminology

steps: Opens Word Library
Searches 'tachycardia' — no results

Searches 'heart' — no results (no medical category exists)
Browses all categories — no medical/health category
Disappointed — goes back to manual card creation
Types 'tachycardia' manually in /cards/new

issues_found.description: No medical/health vocabulary category in the word library — professionals studying specialized terminology find no relevant content

simulations.feedback: I need medical terms. The library categories are too generic for my use case.

simulations.persona: Yuki, 17, TOEFL prep, advanced user, fast phone
simulations.scenario: Uses Featured Words for quick card creation
steps: Opens Word Library

Goes back to library

Goes back again — taps 'negotiate'

simulations.feedback: The library + AI combo is amazing but the 3/day limit kills it. At least let me create cards from library without AI count.

Taps 'paradigm' — creates card with AI

simulations.persona: Marcus, 23, security tester, advanced technical
simulations.scenario: Tests the API endpoint directly with various inputs
steps: Opens /api/word-library — gets categories JSON
Tries /api/word-library?action=category&id=daily-vocabulary — gets category data
Tries /api/word-library?action=category&id=../../etc/passwd — gets 404 (safe)
Tries /api/word-library?action=search&q=<script>alert(1)</script> — returns empty results (safe, no XSS)
Tries /api/word-library?action=search&q=a — gets 400 (minimum 2 chars enforced)
Tries /api/word-library?action=search&q= — gets 400 (empty query rejected)
Tries /api/word-library?action=difficulty&level=invalid — gets 400
Tries /api/word-library?action=nonexistent — gets 400
Tests /cards/new?word=<script>alert(1)</script> — React escapes it (safe)
Overall security posture is good

issues_found.description: The API route at /api/word-library has no authentication — all word data is publicly accessible without login. While the data isn't sensitive, this could be used for scraping.

simulations.feedback: Solid input validation on the API. No XSS possible since React escapes everything.

simulations.persona: Lisa, 33, GRE prep, iPhone SE (small screen)
simulations.scenario: Uses Word Library on a small screen device
steps: Opens library on small iPhone SE screen
Hero banner takes significant space but scrolls away
Category cards display correctly — single column layout works
Taps Academic Words — sees word list
Word cards are readable — definition text is well-sized
Difficulty badges are small but visible
Taps filter icon — filter chips appear
Filter chips wrap properly on small screen
Featured words scroll horizontally — this works well
Taps 'criterion' — navigated to card creation
Word input populated correctly

issues_found.description: The filter toggle button in category detail view has no label or tooltip — just a Filter icon. Users may not discover it.

simulations.feedback: The library works well on my small phone. Good responsive design.

simulations.persona: Raj, 22, student in India, free tier user
simulations.scenario: Tries to create multiple cards from the library in one session
steps: Opens library — browses Technology category
Taps 'algorithm' — AI generates, card created
Returns to library — taps 'encryption'
AI generates, card created
Returns to library — taps 'cybersecurity'
AI generates, card created (3rd)
Returns to library — taps 'database'
Navigated to /cards/new?word=database
Word populated but AI generation fails — daily limit reached
Sees limit banner but the word is pre-filled
Can still write sentences manually

issues_found.description: No batch/multi-select feature in the library — users must select one word at a time, navigate to card creation, create it, then go back. Very tedious for creating multiple cards.

simulations.feedback: Let me select multiple words and create them all at once! Going back and forth is slow.

simulations.persona: Sarah, 45, parent helping 12-year-old with homework
simulations.scenario: Browses Emotions & Feelings category with her child
steps: Opens Word Library
Sees categories — taps 'Emotions & Feelings'
Browses words: anxious, compassion, empathy, gratitude
These are appropriate and educational for a child

Selects 'grateful' — oops, it's 'gratitude' (child wanted 'grateful')
Card creation shows 'gratitude' — AI generates sentences
AI sentences are dramatic (per original system prompt) — not child-friendly
Library words are fine but AI output is still intense

issues_found.description: The Word Library provides appropriate vocabulary but the AI sentence generation still uses the dramatic/intense system prompt — the library doesn't change the AI tone. Library words get the same scary sentences.

simulations.feedback: The word list is great for my kid but the AI sentences are still too intense. The library should come with calmer sentences.

Taps 'collaborate' — navigated to card creation
Types partial search 'ne' — finds 'negotiate', 'necessary', 'generous', 'serenity'
Search is responsive even on slow connection (client-side filtering)
simulations.feedback: I like that search works instantly without internet since it's local data.

simulations.persona: David, 28, power user comparing to Anki
simulations.scenario: Evaluates the library for completeness and data structure
steps: Opens library — counts 6 categories
Checks each category — each has 30 words

Searches 'obsequious' — not found
Searches 'perspicacious' — not found
Many advanced GRE words are missing
No way to suggest or add words to the library
No indication of which words user has already created cards for

180 total words in 6 categories is a good start but insufficient for serious exam prep (GRE has 1000+ frequently tested words)

simulations.feedback: Mark words I've already added so I don't create duplicates. Also need more advanced vocab.

simulations.persona: Mike, 26, intermediate learner, testing edge cases
simulations.scenario: Tests library with rapid interactions and back/forward navigation
steps: Opens library — rapidly taps multiple categories
Last tap wins — correct behavior

consolidated_issues.title: No duplicate card detection
consolidated_issues.description: Library doesn't track which words the user has already created cards for — users can accidentally create duplicate cards
consolidated_issues.fix_approach: Check user's existing cards against library words and show a 'created' badge
consolidated_issues.fix_deferred_reason: Requires database query per library load — would need API integration beyond current scope

consolidated_issues.title: State resets on navigation back
consolidated_issues.description: When navigating back from card creation, library category and filter selections are lost
consolidated_issues.fix_approach: Use URL search params to persist category and filter state, or use sessionStorage

consolidated_issues.title: Category not in URL state
consolidated_issues.description: Browser back button returns to main library, not selected category. Category is not bookmarkable.
consolidated_issues.fix_approach: Store selected category in URL search parameters

consolidated_issues.title: Duplicate word across categories
consolidated_issues.description: 'optimize' appears in both Business English and Technology categories
consolidated_issues.fix_approach: Rename the Technology version to 'optimize' → keep and Business to a different word, or remove duplicate

consolidated_issues.title: Difficulty badge text too small
consolidated_issues.description: 9px difficulty badge is hard to read for users with larger text settings

consolidated_issues.title: Filter button has no label
consolidated_issues.description: The filter toggle in category detail view is just an icon with no label or tooltip
consolidated_issues.fix_approach: Add aria-label and/or visible 'Filter' text label
